medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had episodes of skin infections and impaired hearing since birth, with diagnosis of multiple exostoses in childhood. At presentation, she exhibited marked peripheral edema and had 24 g/d proteinuria, albumin 23 g/L, and serum creatinine 1.1 mg/dl. She suffered a relapse 3 months after the initial treatment and experienced further relapses at 6 months, then at 18 months after cyclosporine was stopped.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Skin infections, impaired hearing, multiple exostoses diagnosed in childhood.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of renal disease and hearing impairment; one brother with steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome at age 4, father had acute renal failure at age 69 with a biopsy showing pauci-immune focal segmental proliferative glomerulonephritis, two nephews with childhood nephrotic syndrome, and a cousin with kidney disease and exostoses.
